cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 85 mi (140 km) ESE of Progreso, Mexico and 560 mi (905 km) south of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating north-north-eastward across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the southeast Louisiana and Mississippi coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast (between Morgan City and the mouth of the Mississippi River, near Port Fourchon/Buras)

weather_observation.watch_coast: West of Morgan City to Intracoastal City Louisiana (Tropical Storm Watch area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Morgan City Louisiana to the Mississippi/Alabama border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern Louisiana, Mississippi, and Alabama Gulf coasts
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Yes (forecast 4–6 ft for Port Fourchon to Lake Borgne, including lower Mississippi River reaches)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) likely; hurricane-force gusts possible Wednesday evening
weather_observation.storm_surge: 4–6 ft inundation possible near and east of the river outlets, including areas adjacent to the port
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with local 6 inches; flash and urban flooding risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Scattered tornadoes Wednesday/Wednesday night; short-fused channel restrictions or closures likely due to high water and strong currents
